alert.note: Alert for Caswell; Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN ROCKINGHAM AND CASWELL COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oregon Hill, or near Reidsville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Eden... Reidsville... Wentworth... Yanceyville... Bethel... Jericho... and Prospect Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
